thread.title_full: Man charged with manslaughter over Conan Anderson death | UTV - ITV News

title: Man charged with manslaughter over Conan Anderson death | UTV - ITV News
text:
21 February 2017 at 9:43pm Man charged with manslaughter over Conan Anderson death Conan Anderson pictured, who died in hospital last Saturday. Credit: PSNI/Family photo 
A 27-year-old man has been charged with manslaughter in connection with the death of Conan Anderson, who died after sustaining a head injury on a night out in Belfast. 
The man, who was arrested in the city on Tuesday morning, is due to appear at Belfast Magistratesâ€™ Court on Wednesday. 
Twenty-two-year-old Conan Anderson sustained a serious head injury in an incident at Arthur Lane in the early hours of Monday 6 February. 
The football coach had made it back to his Short Strand home that morning, but was later admitted to hospital where he passed away on Saturday. Last updated Tue 21 Feb 2017
